events.name: Tech Talk-Computer Science 101
events.description:
Computers have become such an indispensable feature in our lives that living without one has become almost unthinkable. But have you ever wondered how these seemingly complicated machines work?

Get an introduction to computers, software, the internet and their practical applications in this newbie friendly introductory talk that aims to demystify Computer Science

The speaker:

Kai Zhou, currently a senior engineer at a multi-strategy hedge fund. He has 8 years of experience working as full-time software engineer. Before joining finance industry, he used to be a senior programmer from game industry, worked on titles such as Need for Speed World, The Sims 4, Ghost Recon Phantoms and other unannounced titles.

Agenda:

>>What is computer, hardware and software?
>>Deeper insight into software
>>How does the internet works?
>>Computer Security
>>How to shift your career to software domain?
>>Overview of programming opportunities and tools.

Register for your tickets here: http://cs101techtalk.peatix.com/

events.name: Book Club: Algorithms on Graphs – Decomposition of Graphs
events.description: New Course: Algorithms on Graphs on Coursera  Come and learn with a group of us working through this online course together. Description Outside of lists, sets & hash maps, graphs are one of the most common and useful data structures you will encounter in your programming career. Graphs are useful in a wide variety different contexts such as mapping, social networks, geometry & artificial intelligence. See https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs for more info on this course. Coursera offers a free "auditor" option and a paid option, if you want a certificate at the end. This Week: Decomposition of Graphs 1 & 2 The course duration is 5 Weeks but due to meetup timing we're going to get ahead of schedule by covering the first 2 weeks this week. After this week we'll follow at normal, week-by-week pace. * Week 1: Decomposition of Graphs 1: Lectures (~40 min) & Assignment* Week 2: Decomposition of Graphs 2: Lectures (~35 min) & Start of Assignment How to Participate 1. Watch the lectures and start the week's assignments.2. Find something in the week's content you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting or ask questions.4. Group discussion and friendly banter ensues! All are welcome – beginners, experts, students and professionals. Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore 437032Singapore  Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7.Bring healthy snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS Bookclub Gitter channel: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub Useful Links* https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/1* https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/2 <a href="https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/2"></a>
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Talk.CSS #7
events.description: Sorry for the short notice this time, but we managed to get Microsoft to host us. Come join the CSS nerd out :D Latest CSS news by Talk.CSS Our new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. React and CSS Modules by Thomas GorissenScoped CSS is one of those things on many developers’ wishlists. CSS modules could potentially fulfil that wish. Never heard of CSS modules? Join us and hear all about it. So your designer wants a masthead by Chen Hui JingWhat do you do when you get a design that requires a masthead? Turns out there's more than one way to build a masthead. Also, if you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. Any CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22 Conference Room, Singapore, 018989

events.name: Singapore PHP User Group Meetup - June 2016

events.name: Dork to Suave: Metamorphosis - Preview
events.description:
Want to be able to speak to anyone and communicate on a high level? Want to leave good impressions while still retaining who you are? The geekiness in you is sometimes too high for you to talk reach out to others?
This night is the night specially dedicated to you! It's for people who are looking to remain themselves while talking to others, whether it's the opposite gender or co-workers, and still connect to others easily.
This is how you turn from a dork to a suave!
events.location: Salon du Sens, 49 Niven Road, Singapore 228397
